definition: top floor/attic/loft/garret/penthouse/(flat) rooftop (often used as an outdoor living area etc)

apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]

sentences.english: Mother went into the attic where she poked about among old boxes and trunks.
sentences.chinese: 母亲走上顶楼，在旧箱子里东翻西找。

sentences.english: I mean, it’s just a tall building where you go out on the roof in the middle of Manhattan.
sentences.chinese: 我的意思是，爬到曼哈顿中区一幢高楼的顶楼平台。

sentences.english: The guards saw you with Lentil. Up at the penthouse.
sentences.chinese: 警卫看见了你和兰缇一起，上到顶楼。

sentences.english: I'll put you in one of those rooms.
sentences.chinese: 我们的顶楼有一些空房间。

sentences.english: The Ming's restaurant is located on 36th floor in the Majestic Hotel.
sentences.chinese: 名人汇西餐厅位于大华酒店36层顶楼。

sentences.english: One of the advantages of living on the top floor of a highrise building is that you can get a good view.
sentences.chinese: 住在高层建筑顶楼的好处之一是能让你欣赏到好风景。

sentences.english: Locked up here on the penthouse floor, wearing a white terry-cloth bathrobe all day, counting his money, and talking on the telephone.
sentences.chinese: 关在顶楼，整天穿着毛巾布浴袍，数钱，打电话。

sentences.english: The square stands on the loft of club according to Tong.
sentences.chinese: 方依彤站在俱乐部的顶楼。

sentences.english: The main spiral staircase depicts a rhythmic ribbon that ascends to attic space.
sentences.chinese: 主旋转楼梯像一条螺旋上升的缎带将空间引向顶楼。

sentences.english: Sue and Johnsy had their room at the top of a brick building with three floors.
sentences.chinese: 苏和蔷希的房间在一栋三层楼砌砖建筑物的顶楼上。

sentences.english: Shall we go to the top floor of a bird 's-eye view from there .
sentences.chinese: 我们要不要到它的顶楼，鸟瞰一下风景呢？

sentences.english: Lights burned on the building’s top floor.
Seven treasures amplify by elevator to arrive at loft.
sentences.chinese: 七宝乘着电梯来到顶楼。

sentences.english: Mark reached the top and looked down the stairs. He couldn't see anyone else.
sentences.chinese: 马克到了顶楼并往楼梯下看，但没看到其他人。

sentences.english: To reach the top of the tower by lift takes just a few minutes.
sentences.chinese: 坐电梯到顶楼只要几分钟。

sentences.english: You can enjoy yourself in the rotating cocktail bar on the top floor.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在顶楼的转转鸡尾酒吧里享受一下。

definition: top floor/the top of a building
upstairs/(Internet slang) previous poster in a forum thread
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
balcony/patio/flat roof/terrace/deck (unroofed platform)/outdoor stage/ancient imperial celestial observation terrace
Mt Tiantai near Shaoxing 紹興|绍兴 in Zhejiang, the center of Tiantai Buddhism 天台宗/Tiantai county in Taizhou 台州[Tai1 zhou1], Zhejiang
(used in the names of grand buildings such as 百老匯大廈|百老汇大厦 Broadway Mansions (in Shanghai) or 帝國大廈|帝国大厦 Empire State Building etc)
